biogHist.p: Dramaturg, Director, [ca.1950]-. D.D. Kugler was educated at the University of Northern Ohio (B.A.), the University of Saskatchewan (M.A.), and York University (M.F.A.). A longtime member of the Canadian theatre community, Mr. Kugler's notable accomplishments include co-authoring (with Richard Rose) the play "Newhouse" and the stage adaptations of Michael Ondaatje's "Moving Through Slaughter" and Timothy Findlay's "Not Wanted on the Voyage." Mr. Kugler's was also Production Dramaturg with Toronto based Necessary Angel Theatre Company (1987-1998) and Artistic Director of Edmonton's Northern Light Theatre Company (1993- 1998). In 1998 Mr. Kugler became a full time member of the faculty in Simon Fraser University's School for the Contemporary Arts where he teaches directing, dramaturgy and playmaking.
